pages.text: This bag as multiple functions and behavior, usually requiring to hold the action key (currently set to '$(k:action)').$(br)When you don't have the bag in hand (in another slot, equipped in a curio slot or even when you are inside a bag), using the action key will give you a virtual representation of the bag that allows you to do almost anything as though you had the real bag in hand.
For the rest of the book, consider that when I talk about the bag item, you can assume it is also true for a virtual bag.

While in #Default, you can sneak use ($(k:sneak) + $(k:use)) the bag on a block near you to unequip the bag and spawn the entity counterpart of the bag.$(br)While in entity form, the bag can be used ($(k:use)) to access the items of the bag and sneak use to enter the bag.

You can pickup a bag entity by attacking it ($(k:attack)) or equip it on your back (curio slot) by sneak attacking the bag ($(k:sneak) + $(k:attack)).$(p)To change the bag mode, hold the action key ($(k:action)) and scroll up/down, to see what a mode do (beyond the default behavior), please go to the Modes category of this manual.
